Cebaco Island Project

Degraded land, originally forest land, later used for extensive cattle ranching, is reforested with mostly native tree species and gradually converted into mixed forests. The project provides for sustainable timber production and cocoa cultivation; it protects biodiversity and restores a healthy forest ecosystem. Sustainable forest management and cocoa production offer employment opportunities, therefore improve the economic and social situation of rural communities and families. Moreover, the project helps to promote mutual learning and knowledge transfer. CO2OL Tropical Mix has been one of the first in line to be successfully certified under the renowned Gold Standard for land use and forestry projects; the cocoa production areas have been the first agroforestry systems to be certified under the Gold Standard.

Control Layer

Information About:


Project type Reforestation
Location Panama: provinces panama, Darien and Veraguas
Project size 13.385 hectares
Project developer ForestFinance Group, Sustainable Timber and Eco Cebaco
Standard Gold Standard, FSC, UTZ (cacao)
Validator/certifier Control Union
Communications Project description, brochure, pictures, video, interactive map, background stories, chocolate, project visit is possible
